Q229:
For "USEFUL TIPS"
1. they change from step to step, good.
2. they are very detailed, good; 
but some are too detailed, might be better to consider rephrasing.
3. might be better to rearrange the tips, a purely vertical look is tiring.

For "Chat Box Suggestions"
1. Again, very detailed, but too detailed, phrasing could be more concise.
2. Language using could be more kindly, now feels more like taking an exam.
3. Sometimes the suggestion is quite confusing, I would not know whether I was supposed to make my words more technical, or it's a fault by BURT.
4. One more suggestion... might better to limit the number of possible suggestions, more efficient and no more misleading.

Q242: I had all my suggestions listed on the previous page. But I do have a question for why BURT exists: most video games I played allow users to manually take screenshots or record video for bug reporting. Q229:
On simple applications' bug reports the suggestions worked well (GNU-RC) since there were only a few possible steps to take at the beginning that led to the observed bug. On a bug with multiple steps to replicate (TIME-CC1), the suggestions were a little inaccurate.

I also noticed many suggestions with button circles (yellow) were placed over non-existent buttons. This meant that many suggestions were not valid.
Q231:
Removing these non-existent yellow button suggestions would clean up the process nicely. 

When waiting for a yes/no answer after suggesting these screenshots, the chat box should be disabled until the yes/ no button is selected by the user. I started describing subsequent steps when BURT was awaiting a yes/no answer to a screenshot suggestion, and this led to a bit of confusion on my part with why BURT was rejecting input. (a prompt would also work)
Q234:
Some inputs were not being accepted even though there is accurate language being used. I suspect this will be easier to get the hang of after a little practice with the BOT.

E.g: 
Select "OK" - not recognized 
Click "OK" - recognized

E.g:
BMI calculation crashes application - not recognized
BMI calculation crash - recognized
Q236:
This could be user-error, but a sentence such as

"BMI calculator calculates correct BMI" does not work

Simpler sentences are preferred it seems.
Q239: It always ended up getting there eventually, but the sentence structure has to be clear and simple for BURT to identify accurately.
Q241:
Some of the prompts are rather similar to one another and can be clunky.

As mentioned before, I had an issue where BURT requested a "yes/ no" selection when I was attempting to describe a step. Since the returned error prompt from the bot was a bit vague ("not accepted"), it led to confusion as to why the rejections were happening.

I would think in this case, typing should be disabled until the yes/ no button has been selected to avoid confusion.
Q242: BURT should auto-scroll to the bottom of the chat when screenshot suggestions are given. Autoscroll currently only happens when I start to type.
Q245: Very useful for replicating and visualizing a bug report. Some did not have a screenshot; however the majority did.
Q247:
Add the ability to delete any step in the reported step list. Right now we can only delete the last step which is limiting when I spotted a mistake earlier up in my steps that needed to be deleted.

Also, the user should be prompted to CONFIRM after saying that this was the last step. I had to repeat 2 of the bug reports due to selecting "yes" when BURT asked if this was the last step. This extra confirmation is useful so that the bug report can be reviewed for correctness prior to submission.
Q251:
selecting screenshots is easy for the most part
GUI is very aesthetic
bug report summary graphic is useful
Q252:
describing expected behavior
yes/no prompt questions confusion with description questions
premature submission of report after BURT suggests finishing
multiple screenshots with non-existent buttons leads to cluttered screen
deleting previous steps was difficult as only the most recent can be accessed
simplifying descriptions to key words
Q256:
'- ability to delete any steps
- extra prompts for separating binary "yes/no" from typing "describe the step"
